result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint PreTrial Services DISCHARGE Report dated 11/3/22; received and filed.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10.28.22

Defendant Erica Mary Little not in court.  Attorney Erica N Young in court for Erica Mary Little.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for calendar call.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court takes no action as to bail.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Status Report, filed.

Defendant Erica Mary Little not in court.  Attorney Erica N Young in court for Erica Mary Little.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for status conference. Defendant failing to appear. Defense counsel requests that the Court impose and stay a warrant. State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.
Calendar call scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report
filed.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Erica Mary Little appeared by video.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Erica Mary Little.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.
Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is GRANTED by the Court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Case adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
to Withdraw, Defense, filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Erica Mary Little in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Erica Mary Little appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for status. Defense requests plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned back to Br 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report

Defendant Erica Mary Little in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Erica Mary Little appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held. Defense counsel has discovery but not an offer.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Erica Mary Little in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense in receipt of discovery but awaiting an offer and requests an adjournment. 
Court orders matter adjourned. Case remains calendared in branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Erica Mary Little in court with Attorney Travis Schwantes via zoom.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
